segment.source: Account lockout duration (Windows 10)
segment.target: Account lockout duration (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Account lockout duration security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Account lockout duration security policy setting.

segment.source: Account lockout duration
segment.target: Account lockout duration

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Account lockout duration security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Account lockout duration security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: The Account lockout duration policy setting determines the number of minutes that a locked-out account remains locked out before automatically becoming unlocked.
segment.target: The Account lockout duration policy setting determines the number of minutes that a locked-out account remains locked out before automatically becoming unlocked.

segment.source: The available range is from 1 through 99,999 minutes.
segment.target: The available range is from 1 through 99,999 minutes.

segment.source: A value of 0 specifies that the account will be locked out until an administrator explicitly unlocks it.
segment.target: A value of 0 specifies that the account will be locked out until an administrator explicitly unlocks it.

segment.source: If Account lockout threshold is set to a number greater than zero, Account lockout duration must be greater than or equal to the value of Reset account lockout counter after.
segment.target: If Account lockout threshold is set to a number greater than zero, Account lockout duration must be greater than or equal to the value of Reset account lockout counter after.

segment.source: This policy setting is dependent on the Account lockout threshold policy setting that is defined, and it must be greater than or equal to the value specified for the Reset account lockout counter after policy setting.
segment.target: This policy setting is dependent on the Account lockout threshold policy setting that is defined, and it must be greater than or equal to the value specified for the Reset account lockout counter after policy setting.

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: A user-defined number of minutes from 0 through 99,999
segment.target: A user-defined number of minutes from 0 through 99,999

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.source: If Account lockout threshold is configured, after the specified number of failed attempts, the account will be locked out.
segment.target: If Account lockout threshold is configured, after the specified number of failed attempts, the account will be locked out.

segment.source: If th Account lockout duration is set to 0, the account will remain locked until an administrator unlocks it manually.
segment.target: If th Account lockout duration is set to 0, the account will remain locked until an administrator unlocks it manually.

segment.source: It is advisable to set Account lockout duration to approximately 30 minutes.
segment.target: It is advisable to set Account lockout duration to approximately 30 minutes.

segment.source: To specify that the account will never be locked out, set the value to 0.
segment.target: To specify that the account will never be locked out, set the value to 0.

segment.source: To configure the value for this policy setting so that it never automatically unlocks the account might seem like a good idea; however, doing so can increase the number of requests that your organization’s Help Desk receives to unlock accounts that were locked by mistake.
segment.target: To configure the value for this policy setting so that it never automatically unlocks the account might seem like a good idea; however, doing so can increase the number of requests that your organization’s Help Desk receives to unlock accounts that were locked by mistake.

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsAccount PoliciesPassword Policy
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsAccount PoliciesPassword Policy

segment.target: Default values

segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: More than a few unsuccessful password submissions during an attempt to log on to a computer might represent an attacker's attempts to determine an account password by trial and error.
segment.target: More than a few unsuccessful password submissions during an attempt to log on to a computer might represent an attacker's attempts to determine an account password by trial and error.

segment.source: The Windows and Windows Server operating systems can track logon attempts, and you can configure the operating system to disable the account for a preset period of time after a specified number of failed attempts.
segment.target: The Windows and Windows Server operating systems can track logon attempts, and you can configure the operating system to disable the account for a preset period of time after a specified number of failed attempts.

segment.source: Account lockout policy settings control the threshold for this response and what action to take after the threshold is reached.
segment.target: Account lockout policy settings control the threshold for this response and what action to take after the threshold is reached.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: A denial-of-service (DoS) condition can be created if an attacker abuses the Account lockout threshold policy setting and repeatedly attempts to log on with a specific account.
segment.target: A denial-of-service (DoS) condition can be created if an attacker abuses the Account lockout threshold policy setting and repeatedly attempts to log on with a specific account.

segment.source: After you configure the Account lockout threshold policy setting, the account will be locked out after the specified number of failed attempts.
segment.target: After you configure the Account lockout threshold policy setting, the account will be locked out after the specified number of failed attempts.

segment.source: If you configure the Account lockout duration policy setting to 0, the account remains locked until you unlock it manually.
segment.target: If you configure the Account lockout duration policy setting to 0, the account remains locked until you unlock it manually.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Configure the Account lockout duration policy setting to an appropriate value for your environment.
segment.target: Configure the Account lockout duration policy setting to an appropriate value for your environment.

segment.source: To specify that the account will remain locked until you manually unlock it, configure the value to 0.
segment.target: To specify that the account will remain locked until you manually unlock it, configure the value to 0.

segment.source: When the Account lockout duration policy setting is configured to a nonzero value, automated attempts to guess account passwords are delayed for this interval before resuming attempts against a specific account.
segment.target: When the Account lockout duration policy setting is configured to a nonzero value, automated attempts to guess account passwords are delayed for this interval before resuming attempts against a specific account.

segment.source: Using this setting in combination with the Account lockout threshold policy setting makes automated password guessing attempts more difficult.
segment.target: Using this setting in combination with the Account lockout threshold policy setting makes automated password guessing attempts more difficult.

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: Configuring the Account lockout duration policy setting to 0 so that accounts cannot be automatically unlocked can increase the number of requests that your organization's Help Desk receives to unlock accounts that were locked by mistake.
segment.target: Configuring the Account lockout duration policy setting to 0 so that accounts cannot be automatically unlocked can increase the number of requests that your organization's Help Desk receives to unlock accounts that were locked by mistake.
